posts.title: Missed the last bus again
posts.content: I watched the bus pull away while tying my shoe, like it waited just long enough to be dramatic. Ended up walking home with my headphones dead and my thoughts way too loud. Sometimes the longest routes are the ones you never planned to take.

posts.title: Coffee tasted weird today
posts.content: Same cup, same place, same order — but it tasted completely off. Maybe it was the mood, or maybe I’m just noticing small things more than I used to. Funny how tiny changes can throw off an entire morning.

posts.title: Why does time feel faster now
posts.content: Days blur together unless something breaks the pattern. I swear weeks used to feel longer. Now it’s like I blink and another month is gone. Maybe time didn’t speed up — maybe I just stopped paying attention.

posts.title: Tried cooking without a recipe
posts.content: I trusted my instincts and almost set off the smoke alarm. Somehow it still tasted decent. There’s something satisfying about messing up and surviving it without Googling what to do next.

posts.title: Phone battery anxiety is real
posts.content: Once it hits 20%, my brain goes into emergency mode. I start rationing screen time like it’s food. Amazing how a tiny percentage number can control your behavior.

posts.title: Rain makes the city quieter
posts.content: Everything slows down when it rains. Cars move softer, people walk closer to themselves, and the world feels briefly paused. It’s one of the few times noise feels optional.
